feed.title: svg-edit
feed.subtitle: Development mailing list for svg-edit project.

entry.title: Re: Paid collaboration for SVG-edit modification
entry.summary: Hi James and Lorenzo, James, thank you for suggesting CleverBrush as a good solution here! Lorenzo, I'd be happy to answer all questions you have, feel free to contact me. On Tuesday, April 14, 2020 at 12:08:09 AM UTC+3, James Wright wrote: > > Hi Lorenzo, > > I noticed nobody replied to your

entry.title: Re: Paid collaboration for SVG-edit modification
entry.summary: Hi Lorenzo, I noticed nobody replied to your email. SVG-Edit is basically dead as far as new development is concerned. You might want to take a look at cleverbrush.com as an alternative commercially supported option. The developers are very responsive. We replaced an SVG-Edit solution with

entry.title: Paid collaboration for SVG-edit modification
entry.summary: We are an italian company operating in the field of industrial automation and remote control. We look at SVG-edit project on github for an integration in our web supervision system; we need some modification and add some additional features to this project to adapt it to our system. We are

entry.title: Looking to hire svg edit plugin developer
entry.summary: We have a number of projects that we want to build on top of svg edit and are looking for someone that would be interested in doing this.

entry.title: Plugin to customize how rotation of elements works (looking for guidance or someone to hire)
entry.summary: Hi all, Looking for guidance on developing a plugin to control shape rotation of a group. entry.title: Re: How to fix tool add subpath version 5.0.0

entry.title: Re: Run npm install within the node_modules/svgedit directory
entry.summary: You have to install Node.js (which comes with `npm`). With `npm` installed, if you run the steps above that line, there will be a `node_modules` folder. Brett On 2019/6/26 7:58 PM, Dmitry Chernov wrote: Run npm install within the node_modules/svgedit directory to install the > build tools for

entry.title: Re: Cannot save images
entry.summary: Could you try again against the latest release at https://svg-edit.github.io/svgedit/releases/latest/editor/svg-editor.html ? It now performs as a download for Chrome restrictions (and there is an alert on first run that should either be removed or kept for non-Chrome browsers but that would

entry.title: Re: Documentation generation
entry.summary: With version 3.x, SvgCanvas.md has been removed as docs are now generated with JSDoc. There are also some newer or updated docs within the `/docs` folder, as well as a migration of the old wiki docs (though without all formatting preserved), many of which need updating or possibly deleting.

entry.title: Twitter account
entry.summary: Does anyone know who owns the SVG-edit Twitter account? It'd be nice to be able to announce new releases and project updates... Thanks! Brett

entry.title: Re: A few helping opportunities for newbies or veterans...
entry.summary: And if any intrepid soul wanted to offer to become a "champion" for the SVG-edit extension (which would need updating to work with the current version), that would certainly be an awesome development! See https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T40271#4685442
